result.execSummary:
The defendant Jorge A Marrero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jorge A Marrero

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed.  Copy provided to Defendant via U.S. mail.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, for review. jbs
on counts 1, 2, 3, 4, & 5.  Defendant's address:  Jorge Marrero #362440, Oshkosh Correctional Institution, PO Box 3310, Oshkosh, WI  54903.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING (17 pages) commencing JANUARY 14, 2016 received and filed.
Original Transcript (17 pages) commencing 1-14-2016 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS with 727 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS with 727 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS with 727 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

As to Count 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS with 727 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

As to Count 5:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS with 727 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

As to Count 6:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS with 727 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program after 5 years confinement.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- No contact with co-actor Louis Gonzalez-Ortiz.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Both parties requested an adjournment for sentencing. Court ordered a PSI  with no recommendation., lr  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 12-18-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jorge A Marrero in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Jorge A Marrero in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa.

Attorney Awni M. Yasin in court, defendant Jorge A Marrero not in court, in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Parties are jointly asking for a new sentencing date. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 9/25/2014 at 8:30 am.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.
State is to file the certied JOC on the next date.

Defendant Jorge A Marrero in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Jorge A Marrero in custody. Randy Sitzberger for Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Ismael Maldonado sworn as Spanish interpreter.
AS TO ALL 6 COUNTS:
  Defendant  advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 7/29/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Jorge A Marrero not in court, in custody.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense attorney Awni M Yasin not in court, had a family emergency.  Case is adjourned, and remains calendared in Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jorge A Marrero in court with attorney Awni M. Yasin.  Defendant Jorge A Marrero in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Daen Maldonado sworn as spanish interpreter.
Defendant recinds his request for speedy trial. Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 5/13/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Jorge A Marrero in court with attorney Awni Yasin.  Defendant Jorge A Marrero in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as interpreter:Brenda Bartholomew.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defense motion to dismiss counts 1 - 5 for lack of probable cause is heard, argued by the State and DENIED by the Court for the reasons as stated on the record. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
